data.title: Terrible experience in Miami beach.
data.text:
We got the GPS tour as a birthday gift from a friend. We where very excited as we got to Miami to take the tour.. We want to switch to another day . So I tried to call them in there business hours 10-7 . I tried the whole morning but nobody picked up the phone or react to me emails. So I decide to go there to reschedule my appointment . The guy was friendly and said no problem at all. We can come tomorrow at the same time... All excited we got there next day...but then the disappointment began. The owner was not there... There was a guy who rent the scooters. He had no idea . He called the owner who was in Fort Lauderdale . Finally they organized the go car. As it arrived the disappointment got bigger... It looked like an old bumper car... The guy tried to install the GPS but it was not working . Also with several calls to the owner they didn't got it to run. So we decide we want to have the refund... The only thing what was working was that they took directly the security deposit of 300 dollar from my account.. Now 4 days later its still the hold on my credit card... And to get the 99.- dollar fee back he said I have to call San Francisco. As I said that he please has to organize this and not me in my vacation time sitting on the phone.. He said we will get a refund... Up for today I see nothing on my account... 
So i would never recommend the GPS tour.. Old cars very bad customer service... 
We went to the tourist information. The guy said the owner bought the cars already old and there is always trouble with it... 
So we did a speed boot tour instead what was a lot of fun...

data.title: This is so much fun!  Do it!
data.text: We just returned from Miami Beach and had such a great "3 hour tour" in the GoCar!  We were picked up and delivered to our hotel which saved finding a place to park.  The guys running the office were friendly and knowledgable.  The car worked perfectly and the gps lady giving us directions and the city tour was  easy to follow and gave us a great Miami tour.  We would have missed so many great Miama places  without the GoCar.  I found them on TripAdvisor and the great reviews were right on.  Don't miss this fun tour.  There are two tolls on this tour so take $3.00.....it's a convertible and it's fun with a great toot tool horn!

data.title: Good time and a little education
data.text:
The people that ran the place were very helpful and professional. We rented a little three-wheeled motorcycle thing that included a voice-guided GPS tour of Miami. The little yellow vehicle is so strange that people are always waving and smiling, which I think is fun, but if you don't like feeling conspicuous, this might not be for you. 

There is no top on the vehicle so bring sunscreen. The shop also rents scooters and bikes.

data.title: Self Guided Greatness!
data.text: This tour was truly one of a kind, technology is getting greater every year. Make sure it's not too hot that day because the tour is pretty long and it can get fairly hot in Miami Beach, especially during summer. Other than that this experience was pretty infallible.

data.title: The most fun you can have on three wheels!
data.text: Went on the GoCar Tour in Miami with my wife and another couple and had an absolute blast.  It's fun to tool around Miami Beach in a little car getting to better understand the area with the helpful guided tour.  And truthfully, driving down Collins Ave in South Beach tooting the silly little horn was hilarious.  Trust me - you'll have people taking pictures of you!

data.title: Great Fun!
data.text: One of the best ways to experience South Beach and downtown Miami!

data.title: Absolute Blast
data.text: This was a really fun way to see Miami though probably not a good choice for those who get rattled by things not going exactly as expected.  The GPS cut out several times (probably due to the cloudy/rainy day) and we got lost several times.  At one point, we ended up on a way too busy street for the little car, which was a bit of an interesting thrill moment.  We got back on track fairly quickly each time with the map they provided.  Once, we had to go back to the GoCar place to have the GPS reset.  Even with the hilarious GPS issues, and rain, we had a great time and enjoyed the tour.  We also had some trouble with the reservation.  My friend who had arranged the rental said she tried to call the local office several times and only got a ringing phone.  They were able to give us a car when we got there though so all went fine.

data.title: Great fun! And learned a lot about South Beach!!!
data.text: We just got back from our GoCar tour of South Beach - and we had a blast! Joseph was terrific, and really helpful getting us ready for our ride. The car is a lot of fun to drive. And we can't imagine anyplace better for a GoCar tour than South Beach. We did the 1-hour tour, but were finished in 30 minutes. So we went a second time around! Learned a lot about some of the more colorful and well-known spots - especially on Ocean Drive. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! (Note: we are residents of Broward County and very familiar with South Beach. Still this was worth every penny!)  Thanks, Joseph!

data.title: Here I Come!
data.text: We booked a one hour tour, wished it had been longer.  It was delightful having tourists watch as we rode by.  I perfected the royal wave to acknowledge the interesting stares.  Whenever we saw others taking the trip, we relived our delight.

data.title: Most exhilarating, fun, history snipets tour we enjoyed buzzing around in this bright Yellow tri-wheeled GO Car!
data.text: Go Car was such a fun way to tour all over Miami... Johnny was very friendly and very good to give us super easy operating instructions...The Go Car turn by turn directions accompanied by spinets of history and interesting facts as we passed each point of interest, surpassed our expectations.  The volume and clarity of the self-guided tour is exemplary - very good over road noise.  Our 3hr ride went by all too fast...we even had time to park and take in the Jewish Memorial Museum as suggested in the tour.  We saw a variety of neighborhoods and shopping areas... we blew our horn... we waved ...and turned other tourists heads! Loved seeing the Jackie Gleason Theatre and Lincoln Rd shopping and dining hot spots.

data.title: Terrible customer service!
data.text: Make sure you make reservations directly with the franchaise owner. We made reservation with GoCar headquarters in San Francisco and when we arrived for our full day GoCar tour they said they did not have our reservations but could accomodate us the next day. The next day we arrived and the cars were not there. We had to wait for an hour for them to arrive. When they did arrive one did not have oil in it and the other did not have a GPS that worked. They told us to wait for them to come fix it. It took the technician 1/2 hour to get to us.  This is a fun tour but they only have a few cars and they are in terrible condition. Make sure to check that everything works before you get in. If there is any lights on or if the GPS is slow to start make sure they fix it before you leave their store.

data.title: Fun way to see Miami Beach!
data.text: Had a great time on this tour.  Joseph was very helpful in getting us ready to take our car out. He took extra time with us because he could see I was a little cautious and confused as to how it all worked.  Fun way to see a city in a new way and for the most part all traffic-both car traffic and foot traffic-really seemed to enjoy that we were sharing the road with them and got a kick out of the fun little car.  I would plan on a full three hours to complete the tour.  Also plan on taking about 20-30minutes to get used to driving this type of "car".  One word of warning: it vibrates pretty heavily and you will feel it the entire time.  Other than that, what a great time! Definitely recommend!

data.title: Be sure this is what you want
data.text:
We rented two cars (two adults and one teen) for the one hour tour. With insurance $130. The staff we dealt with were friendly and efficient. With December temps (low 80s) it was pleasant.

Although my GPS did not give out (as mentioned in other reviews), the narration and navigation only work when you are on the tour route. Our two drivers immediately got lost and separated and never saw each other again. Because of the speed you should be traveling (15-20 mph), the narration is not very detailed. ("The X Hotel, on your right, was featured in the movie 'X'," and then you're on to the next). 

When I strayed onto busier (multi-lane) roads, I did not feel safe, as regular vehicles do not appreciate the GoCar pace. I can't imagine taking the 3 hour tour that goes outside the Art Deco area.

If you just want to scoot around for a while and get a glimpse of the Art Deco hotels and have lots of other tourists gawk and wave, this is a fun tour for you. If you want to have a real architectural tour or explore off-route, you will probably not be satisfied.

data.title: Awesome, felt like a star
data.text: These little cars are cool. They are very informative but what we loved the most was the attention you get while driving around. If your comming to south beach, this is a must.

data.title: FUn thing to do in Miami
data.text: We booked the go car tours for Miami and had a great time! The people were great, on time and friendly. The only complaint and reason I didnt give it a five was becausetwo of the four gps systems didnt work in the cars. They told us if they didnt to come back but when your on a time schedule that isnt possible and the cars should work without having to come back. Other than that enjoyed it very much.

data.title: TOO MUCH FUN!
data.text: It was an amazing time!  The gocars are pretty old and rough, but despite that, it was so much fun to be able to tour Miami by ourselves.  I would definitely do it again!!

data.title: A lot of FUN - definitely worth it!!
data.text:
TIP: Do the GoCar early in your stay in MiamiBeach. The tour takes you to interesting spots and you want time later to visit and explore them later in your trip.

The major incentive of choosing GoCar was the free half-hour offered by our GoMiami cards, otherwise it was a bit pricey for us. It is located off of Lincoln Rd, so it was an easy walk from our hotel. The staff was very friendly; we were helped by Joseph who explained everything including the insurance options (which costs $15 and not covered by your car insurance) and gave the idea of opting for the 1-hour rental to be able to do the tour comfortably. Thanks Joseph. Riding the GoCar is a bit of an experience - people stareeee, point, take photos, etc. and we got even more attending because I was honking througout the tour :) The tour mainly takes you through Espanola Way, Ocean Drive, Lincoln Road and Collins Avenue. The lady (voice) guide explains the history, events and trivia of everything you need to know.

We had a lot of fun, just thought we should have done this on the first day to allow us enough time to revisit some of the places that the tour took us. Highly recommended.

data.title: Brilliant way to soak in South Beach in one hour!
data.text: The wife and I did the one hour South Beach highlights tour and just loved it. What a great way to experience South Beach in just one hour. The car operated flawlessly for us including the GPS system. The car even called me "speedy" when I went a little too fast down Ocean Blvd! Haha, we got a good chuckle out of that. Jesus from GoCar Tours made the whole experience a breeze. We would do this again wherever it is offered. 5 stars!

data.title: interesting little car!
data.text:
we were a group of 4 and we purhcased 2 groupons for a gocar tour for 1 hour. not really sure if it was a deal becuase we still had to pay for taxes and insurance so that brought our total to close to the orig price... $50.

it is kind of hard communicating with the tour folks because the phone is rarely picked up so it was very hard to get a hold of them. their office is also kind of hard to find. its not on a main road. anyway, the things are operated like a scooter, not an actual car. the 1 hour tour doesnt go that far and passes by very quick.

their facility is a booth in a shop, don't count on food/bathrooms/lockers for use. they have some soda/water for sale only.

PROS:
-good way to see south beach if you're lazy to walk! it introduces you to lots in the area
-definitely a head turner! people will definitely wave and gawk!
-probably a comfortable experience if its not 100+degrees in humidity in south beach!
-no hidden charges/fees
-easy to get setup /going on the tour

CONS:
-not built for 2 large framed people because you'll be elbowing each other especially in the heat  and humidity of south beach!
-the turns can be short of warning on the gps so don't drive too fast!
-its an open car so expect gas smell your whole ride. its also quite bumpy (the car vibrates the whole time while you drive it)
-its a very small car and during times with lots of traffic it can feel intimidating
-theres really no safety harnesses so pray that your friend or you do not get into an accident
-hard to get ahold of the tour people on the phone. best to walk in and make a reservation.
-hard for the driver to really focus on what the gps is saying because theyre focused on driving the route properly

with all that said, i would recommend it and i would consider doing it again for the 3 hour tour in nice windy weather.. otherwise do the 1 hour tour in the heat because thats pushing it already... but hopefully south beach's weather won't melt me the next time because boy was i breaking a sweat!! the guys who work at the shop actually follow you along your route to make sure you are on schedule/not lost so that was neat. if you are not familiar with the area it can be hard to get back on track because the map they provide is not very clear.

data.title: Fun way to see South Beach
data.text: It was a great way to tour South Beach in a fun two seated motorized car.  Bring your sunglasses though because the wind and the sun take their toll.  Jesus was a great help in showing us how to navigate through the tour and we didn't have any problems.
